content:
• Thursday, December 20, 2012
  • HEB

    After struggling to make recommendations about the product, an FDA panel rejects Hemispherx...

    After struggling to make recommendations about the product, an FDA panel rejects Hemispherx Biopharma's (NYSEMKT:HEB) chronic fatigue syndrome treatment Ampligen, saying it isn't ready for marketing. Several panel members struggled with their decisions because it appears the drug works in certain patients even if it wasn't strongly shown in the clinical data presented to the panel. Shares -20% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:21 PM | 7 Comments
  • FCEL

    More on FuelCell Energy (NASDAQ:FCEL): FQ4 misses on the bottom line but beat on top line...

    More on FuelCell Energy (NASDAQ:FCEL): FQ4 misses on the bottom line but beat on top line revenue. Net losses widened over the quarter as the power-equipment maker's expenses grew. The company hasn't posted an annual profit since 1997, but its revenue has generally improved over the past year, as cheap natural gas has driven down its power-production costs and boosted demand. Product sales grew 1.7% to $35.4M, while R&D contracts increased 9.3% to $1.6M. Shares +6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:57 PM
  • FCEL

    FuelCell Energy (NASDAQ:FCEL): FQ4 EPS of -$0.07 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $35.4M beats by...

    FuelCell Energy (NASDAQ:FCEL): FQ4 EPS of -$0.07 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $35.4M beats by $5M. Shares +5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:54 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM) has done an about-face: shares are down 11.6% AH following its FQ3...

    Research In Motion (RIMM) has done an about-face: shares are down 11.6% AH following its FQ3 call. RIM mentioned its services business (36% of revenue, and a bigger share of profits) could be pressured by a pricing overhaul that will come with BB10 - it'll offer a variety of service options, and some of the basic ones won't cost much. Also, the fact RIM's subscriber base is now declining and shifting towards emerging markets will affect services revenue. The U.S., U.K., and Canada made up 36% of FQ3 sales, down from FQ2's 42%. (FQ3: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • NKE

    More on Nike (NYSE:NKE): FQ2 beats on both top and bottom line as sales continue to grow at the...

    More on Nike (NYSE:NKE): FQ2 beats on both top and bottom line as sales continue to grow at the retail giant. Net profit shrank 18% Y/Y however, weighed down by $137M in losses tied to the sale of its Umbro and Cole Haan brands. Regionally, growth was strongest in North America, which offset weakness in China and Western Europe. Shares +2.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:52 PM
  • BB

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: RIMM +7%. RHT +6%. NKE +5%. CAMP +4%. TIBX +4%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: RIMM +7%. RHT +6%. NKE +5%. CAMP +4%. TIBX +4%.
    After-hours top losers: SB -14%. DTLK -8%. BXE -4%. MU -3%. GOL -2%.

  • VALE

    Vale (NYSE:VALE) says it will take a $4.2B writedown on its nickel and aluminum investments,...

    Vale (NYSE:VALE) says it will take a $4.2B writedown on its nickel and aluminum investments, part of a series of charges that will hit the miner's Q4 earnings. Most of the charges are related to its troubled Onca Puma nickel mine in Brazil, which was shuttered in June. The total charge before taxes for Onca Puma will total $2.85B. VALE -2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • TIBX

    Tibco (NASDAQ:TIBX): FQ4 EPS of $0.42 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $296.5M (+2% Y/Y) beats by $3M....

    Tibco (NASDAQ:TIBX): FQ4 EPS of $0.42 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $296.5M (+2% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Expects FQ1 revenue of $241M-$245M and EPS of $0.17-$0.18 vs. consensus of $240.7M and $0.21. 195 deals over $100K and 25 deals over $1M in FQ4, up from 134 over $100K and 16 over $1M in FQ3. Shares +6.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM) has resumed trading. Shares are up 7.1% AH, as investors give a...

    Research In Motion (RIMM) has resumed trading. Shares are up 7.1% AH, as investors give a thumbs-up to its FQ3 beat, gross margin improvement, and $950M in operating cash flow.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM | 6 Comments
  • NKE

    Nike (NYSE:NKE): FQ2 EPS of $1.14 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $6.0B (+7% Y/Y) beats by $0.01B....

    Nike (NYSE:NKE): FQ2 EPS of $1.14 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $6.0B (+7% Y/Y) beats by $0.01B. Shares +2.7% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM): FQ3 EPS of -$0.22 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $2.73B (-47% Y/Y) beats...

    Research In Motion (RIMM): FQ3 EPS of -$0.22 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $2.73B (-47% Y/Y) beats by $70M. 6.9M BlackBerrys shipped, 255K PlayBooks. BlackBerry subs fell by 1M Q/Q to 79M. Shares halted. (PR)

    Micron (NASDAQ:MU): Q3 EPS of -$0.27 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $2.0B in-line. Shares -3% AH. (PR)

    Micron (NASDAQ:MU): Q3 EPS of -$0.27 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $2.0B in-line. Shares -3% AH. (PR)

    Red Hat (NYSE:RHT): Q3 EPS of $0.29 in-line. Revenue of $344M (+18% Y/Y) beats by $6.43M. Shares +3.97% premarket. (PR)

  • GPRC

    Guanwei Recycling (GPRC +7.2%) finishes the day strong after the China-based manufacturer of...

    Guanwei Recycling (GPRC +7.2%) finishes the day strong after the China-based manufacturer of recycled low density polyethylene announced that it has regained compliance with Nasdaq by maintaining a closing share price of at least $1 for 10 consecutive business days.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • MDCO

    Leerink ups its price target for The Medicines Co. (MDCO +7.1%) to $34 from $30 on the back of...

    Leerink ups its price target for The Medicines Co. (MDCO +7.1%) to $34 from $30 on the back of the drug developer's previously announced positive results for the Phase III trial of oritavancin. The firm now sees it as a takeout candidate and reiterates an Outperform. Separately, JPMorgan also ups the shares to Overweight.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • VHC

    VirnetX (VHC -4.7%) is off a trading halt, with the company reporting a judge - in a post-trial...

    VirnetX (VHC -4.7%) is off a trading halt, with the company reporting a judge - in a post-trial hearing - has ordered Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) to provide updated sales data for certain products, including the iPhone 5 by mid-January. The company recently won a $368.2M judgement against Apple for patent infringement. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM | 7 Comments
  • EMN

    Eastman Chemical (EMN +1.6%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $75 price target at Gilford...

    Eastman Chemical (EMN +1.6%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $75 price target at Gilford Securities, which believes EMN Eastman is "poised to become the premier, most-favored holding in the chemical space, on the basis of both its businesses and its management credibility."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM
  • FLIR

    FLIR Systems (FLIR +2.7%) gets a boost today from an upgrade to Buy at Sterne Agee with a $30...

    FLIR Systems (FLIR +2.7%) gets a boost today from an upgrade to Buy at Sterne Agee with a $30 price target. The firm says that FLIR is back on the path to growth, and near term pressures stemming from both its commercial and government end markets provides an attractive entry point for long-term investors.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • AWAY

    HomeAway (AWAY +8.5%) is among the day's tech standouts after catching an upgrade to Overweight...

    HomeAway (AWAY +8.5%) is among the day's tech standouts after catching an upgrade to Overweight from Barclays. 28.5% of the vacation rental listings site's float was shorted as of Nov. 30.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • HLF

    Pershing Square's Bill Ackman gives his presentation on Herbalife (HLF -4.2%) this morning, and...

    Pershing Square's Bill Ackman gives his presentation on Herbalife (HLF -4.2%) this morning, and Barron's Brandon Conway was there to take notes. Ackman kicks it all off by saying he is in fact short the stock, but refutes the accusation that he's pushing the shares down because he owns puts due to expire at the end of the week. He focuses instead on what he sees as HLF's questionable R&D, phony reliance on PhD credentials, and flashy sales promotions as demonstrable proof of the classic pyramid scheme. Take a look: Barron's HLF presentation notes.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM | 9 Comments
  • ROMA

    Midday top 10 gainers: ROMA +65%. ACFC +51%. NYX +33%. AMPL +37%. ELOQ +31%. SINO +22%. BNSO...

    Midday top 10 gainers: ROMA +65%. ACFC +51%. NYX +33%. AMPL +37%. ELOQ +31%. SINO +22%. BNSO +21%. DYNT +22%. SQNS +14%. RAD +16%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: CCU -60%. FOLD -45%. BOSC -19%. MDRX -13%. UNXL -13%. GBX -11%. QUAD -11%. ARII -11%. PTEK -10%. GBR -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • MLNX

    Mellanox (MLNX -6.7%) gives back yesterday's Oracle-fueled gains after Israel's Globes reports...

    Mellanox (MLNX -6.7%) gives back yesterday's Oracle-fueled gains after Israel's Globes reports of heavy institutional selling, something its sources attribute to expectations Q4 and perhaps Q1 results will miss expectations. The paper notes short interest has soared, and suggests a CFO change and "conservative" commentary at presentations has institutions on edge. Shares have already been crushed thanks to soft Q4 guidance. Barclays remains bullish, arguing demand for low-latency, high-speed, data center connectivity will continue driving growth. (Kerrisdale Capital)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • HERO

    Hercules Offshore's (HERO +4.6%) share price target is raised to $7.50 from $6.50 at Dahlman...

    Hercules Offshore's (HERO +4.6%) share price target is raised to $7.50 from $6.50 at Dahlman Rose, as the firm increases its 2013 EPS estimate to $0.50 from $0.35 (consensus $0.27) and its adjusted EBITDA estimate 9% to $351M due to higher leading-edge fixtures following yesterday's fleet status report.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • BIIB

    Biogen Idec (BIIB -0.2%) says it's collaborating with several leading academic research centers...

    Biogen Idec (BIIB -0.2%) says it's collaborating with several leading academic research centers to leverage a range of scientific techniques and disciplines to identify new approaches to treating amyotrophic lateral sclerosis. It is anticipated that coordinating research and sharing results across a number of different disciplines will greatly accelerate the understanding of the mechanisms of the disease and the development of new treatments.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • PRAN

    Prana Biotechnology (PRAN +3.2%) moves up after being initiated at Burrill Institutional...

    Prana Biotechnology (PRAN +3.2%) moves up after being initiated at Burrill Institutional Research with an Outperform and a price target of $5 a share. Burrill cites the company's progress in developing technology for the treatment of neurodegenerative disorders. Yesterday PRAN announced that it's completed recruitment in its Phase IIa clinical trial using its experimental drug PBT2 for the treatment of patients with Huntington Disease.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • CME

    It took the market a few minutes to figure it out, but the ICE/NYSE deal puts a bulls eye on the...

    It took the market a few minutes to figure it out, but the ICE/NYSE deal puts a bulls eye on the back of the CME, now -3%. NYSE has tried and failed to challenge the Chicago derivatives operator, but ICE - which built a serious competitor to CME in what seems like the blink of an eye - has expertise the Big Board doesn't have. ICE -2.6%, NYX +31.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • AMD

    AMD (AMD -4.2%) is slumping, and Intel (INTC -0.5%) and Nvidia (NVDA -0.6%) are slightly off,...

    AMD (AMD -4.2%) is slumping, and Intel (INTC -0.5%) and Nvidia (NVDA -0.6%) are slightly off, after Evercore's Patrick Wang joins the estimate-cutting parade, and co-worker Rob Cihra offers mixed commentary about PC demand. While holding out hope Windows 8 and China will lead demand to stabilize in 1H, Cihra notes many industry suppliers appear to have under-shipped end-user sales (which themselves aren't great) in Q4 thanks to inventory drawdowns. "Early ultrabooks have been stymied by high prices and Win8 so far looks like a remarkable non-factor.," he adds.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • MDRX

    Leerink says there's potentially still a chance of an eventual sale of Allscripts (MDRX -16%),...

    Leerink says there's potentially still a chance of an eventual sale of Allscripts (MDRX -16%), despite yesterday's statement by the company regarding the conclusion of its strategic review process and decision not to put itself up for sale. It probably won't occur in the near term, however, so consequently the firm predicts the stock will continue to face significant pressure. It reduces its target range to $8 - $9 from $12 - $14.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • TROV

    Trovagene (TROV +8%) gets a pop today after granting Novartis (NYSE:NVS) subsidiary Genoptix...

    Trovagene (TROV +8%) gets a pop today after granting Novartis (NYSE:NVS) subsidiary Genoptix licensing rights to incorporate its nucleophosmin protein, NPM1, into research and clinical testing services for acute myelogenous leukemia. Trovagene holds an exclusive patent on the protein. Terms of the agreement include upfront fees and royalty payments. Additional financial terms were not disclosed. Additionally, Roth Capital initiates the shares with a Buy and a price target of $11 a share.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • OCZ

    OCZ Technology (OCZ +4.2%) rallies some more after announcing it has received an extension to...

    OCZ Technology (OCZ +4.2%) rallies some more after announcing it has received an extension to regain NASDAQ listing compliance, after being granted an exception related to its delayed Aug. quarter 10-Q filing. OCZ still has to file the 10-Q, and all other delinquent reports, by Feb. 28. Shares are now up 80% from their Nov. 23 low. (PR) (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM | 2 Comments
  • DFS

    More on Discover (DFS -3%) FQ4 earnings: Bulls on the high-flier (+61% YTD) may have a buying...

    More on Discover (DFS -3%) FQ4 earnings: Bulls on the high-flier (+61% YTD) may have a buying opportunity as the earnings miss looks to be the result of an 18% increase in expenses thanks to costs associated with the Tree.com acquisition and new partnerships. Operationally: Total loans +6% Y/Y, net interest margin +34 bps, net charge-offs a historical low of 2.29%, delinquency rate of 1.86% down 53 bps. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM | 3 Comments
  • HLF

    BofA Merrill Lynch comes to the defense of Herbalife (HLF -5%) this morning, saying there's no...

    BofA Merrill Lynch comes to the defense of Herbalife (HLF -5%) this morning, saying there's no evidence to validate the accusation that the company's a pyramid scheme. The firm notes that HLF has one of the strongest balance sheets in the group, with the potential to drive $1 per share in EPS accretion if it were to fully exercise its $1B buyback. The stock may be pressured over the near-term until this blows over, but Merrill reiterates a Buy with a $65 target.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM | 3 Comments
  • ARRS

    Arris (ARRS +5.5%) is well off the AH highs it saw on news it's buying Motorola's...

    Arris (ARRS +5.5%) is well off the AH highs it saw on news it's buying Motorola's pay-TV/broadband hardware unit from Google, but is still posting a decent gain. With the combined company sporting 500 customers in 70 countries, the deal will go a long way towards helping Arris diversify: right now, it gets about half its sales from Comcast and Time Warner. (previous: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • SD

    SandRidge Energy (SD -5.3%) is cut to Hold from Buy at KeyBanc after striking a deal to sell its...

    SandRidge Energy (SD -5.3%) is cut to Hold from Buy at KeyBanc after striking a deal to sell its Permian Basin assets for $2.6B. Though the deal essentially prefunds its Mississippian development for the next few years, the firm believes the ultimate returns and oil/liquids mix of the Mississippian remains an open question and generally is inferior to Permian returns.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 4 Comments
  • VVUS

    Vivus (VVUS +4%) moves up this morning after it announced that Express Scripts (ESRX +0.2%) has...

    Vivus (VVUS +4%) moves up this morning after it announced that Express Scripts (ESRX +0.2%) has added its weight-loss drug Qsymia to its national pharmacy formularies. The drug has been added as a standard benefit option in a tier-3 position with a prior authorization. Under the plan, participating patients will now pay around $50 to $60 for their co-payment for a monthly prescription, which equates to approximately one-third of the retail price.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 3 Comments
  • ET-OLD

    ExactTarget (ET-OLD +4.5%) is rallying on news of Oracle's (ORCL +0.3%) deal to acquire cloud...

    ExactTarget (ET-OLD +4.5%) is rallying on news of Oracle's (ORCL +0.3%) deal to acquire cloud marketing rival Eloqua (ELOQ +31.1%). Oracle's purchase comes a few months after it snapped up social media marketing plays Vitrue, Collective Intellect, and Involver. The purchase could allow Oracle to offer a more comprehensive marketing solution (for now, anyway) than Salesforce.com (NYSE:CRM), which (relying on Buddy Media) recently launched its social media-focused Marketing Cloud suite. GigaOm notes Eloqua has 1,200 customers for Oracle to cross-sell to.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • TGT

    Cleveland Research downgrades Target (TGT -1.8%) to Neutral from Buy on valuation concerns and...

    Cleveland Research downgrades Target (TGT -1.8%) to Neutral from Buy on valuation concerns and in light of the firm's channel checks showing the retailer is seeing sluggish December sales trends.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM
  • END

    Shares of Endeavour International (END +2.6%) open higher after Steelhead Partners disclosed an...

    Shares of Endeavour International (END +2.6%) open higher after Steelhead Partners disclosed an 11.7% stake via a 13D filing out last night. The hedge fund says it intends to engage in discussions with END concerning actions that might "improve corporate governance and unlock value for shareholders, including a thorough evaluation of all strategic alternatives."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • JCP

    Shares of J.C. Penney (JCP -4.1%) slip lower as investors seem edgy with the Ira Sohn conference...

    Shares of J.C. Penney (JCP -4.1%) slip lower as investors seem edgy with the Ira Sohn conference in full swing in New York City. The combination of Bill Ackman and a live microphone has some traders heading to the sidelines.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM | 1 Comment
  • CCL

    Carnival (NYSE:CCL): FQ4 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $3.6B beats by $0.06B. Shares...

    Carnival (NYSE:CCL): FQ4 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $3.6B beats by $0.06B. Shares -2.6% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM

  • Market preview: U.S. stock futures are oscillating around zero following a data dump earlier and...

    Market preview: U.S. stock futures are oscillating around zero following a data dump earlier and as the talks over the fiscal cliff hit the latest bump. The S&P benchmark is -0.1%, while European shares are green in choppy trading. NYSE soars 42% on ICE's generous acquisition offer, while Illumina is +9% on speculation it might be sold to Roche. Later: Existing Home Sales, Philly Fed Business Outlook, RIM and Nike earnings
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • ROMA

    Premarket gainers: ROMA +57%. NYX +40%. ELOQ +30%. RAD +16%. ILMN +9%. VVUS +8%. NDAQ +7%. ARRS...

    Premarket gainers: ROMA +57%. NYX +40%. ELOQ +30%. RAD +16%. ILMN +9%. VVUS +8%. NDAQ +7%. ARRS +6%. ICE +6%. JBL +5%.
    Losers: FOLD -44%. MDRX -16%. OSIR -10%. NBG -5%. BBBY -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 2 Comments

  • Gold and silver slide again in a big late-year sell off taking on a curious resemblance (I, II)...

    Gold and silver slide again in a big late-year sell off taking on a curious resemblance (I, II) to the price action at the end of 2011. Followers of the precious metals hardly need to be reminded that bear market ended on the last trading day of the year, and was followed by a big bull run in Q1. GLD -0.9%, SLV -2.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM | 20 Comments
  • NYX

    More on the ICE/NYSE hookup: Following the purchase, ICE plans to try and spin off Euronext -...

    More on the ICE/NYSE hookup: Following the purchase, ICE plans to try and spin off Euronext - NYX's European stock exchange operation. The "crown jewel" of this deal is NYX's European derivatives operation - the Liffe, and ICE just paid a lot to get it. CME Group +0.2% premarket. ICE -4.1% premarket, but has been halted since 90 minutes before the official announcement. NYX remains halted.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM
  • ORCL

    Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) purchases cloud marketing software provider Eloqua (NASDAQ:ELOQ) for...

    Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) purchases cloud marketing software provider Eloqua (NASDAQ:ELOQ) for $23.50/share, about $871M. Eloqua shares are halted premarket. They closed last night at $17.92. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:07 AM
  • KMX

    More on CarMax's (NYSE:KMX) Q3: Total used units rose 16% with more compelling credit offers on...

    More on CarMax's (NYSE:KMX) Q3: Total used units rose 16% with more compelling credit offers on the table. On that front, CarMax Auto Finance saw its revenue increase 16% to $72.5M with managed receivable higher. The used vehicle average selling price unchanged from last year's Q3. The company now has eight of the ten superstores it planned to open in FY13 in operation. Shares +6.2% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:04 AM
  • RAD

    Shares of Rite Aid (NYSE:RAD) shoot up 19.5% in premarket action after the drugstore operator...

    Shares of Rite Aid (NYSE:RAD) shoot up 19.5% in premarket action after the drugstore operator smashes estimates with its Q3 report by turning a small profit. The full-year outlook for a smaller loss than forecast is also putting a charge into traders.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:38 AM
  • ARRS

    Arris (NASDAQ:ARRS) finished AH trading up 16.9%, and Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) down 0.4%, following...

    Arris (NASDAQ:ARRS) finished AH trading up 16.9%, and Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) down 0.4%, following the Motorola Home deal. In a call discussing the deal, Arris claimed Google has agreed to cap Arris' liability in TiVo's patent suit against Motorola to "a very small number." Many think the total liability could be enormous (I, II). Long-term, Arris/Motorola should be a formidable rival to Cisco's (NASDAQ:CSCO) Scientific Atlanta, but there's some potential for near-term share loss as integration issues are dealt with and customers try to re-diversify their sources.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 AM
